summary: This bill, the Apprenticeships for Small Businesses Act of 2025, amends the Internal Revenue Code to establish a tax credit for small businesses that employ qualifying career and technical education students. The credit is calculated as 50% of qualified wages paid to these employees, plus qualified workmen's compensation expenses, up to a maximum of $10,000 per year.  Qualified employees are defined as those under 21, participating in registered apprenticeships, or enrolled in relevant vocational programs. The bill also specifies how the credit is applied and includes an effective date of January 1, 2026.
